_description: Umbrella Insurance Sample Data - Use this template for creating umbrella insurance pages

data.recommended_for: High net worth individuals, landlords, business owners
data.intro_content: Umbrella insurance provides extra liability protection beyond your auto and home policies. California residents pay an average of $400/year for $1M coverage.
data.requirements_content: Requires underlying auto and home policies with minimum liability limits, typically $300,000 for home and $250,000/$500,000 for auto.
what_it_covers: Bodily injury liability beyond auto/home limits

faqs.question: How much umbrella insurance do I need?
faqs.answer: Coverage should equal your net worth. Most experts recommend at least $1-2 million.

faqs.question: What does umbrella insurance NOT cover?
faqs.answer: Does not cover your own injuries, business losses, or intentional acts.
